exit.1: A way out of a building, room, or passenger vehicle.
exit.2: An act of leaving a place.

danger.1: The possibility of suffering harm or injury.

help.1: Make it easier or possible for (someone) to do something by offering them one's services or resources.
help.2: (help oneself) Serve someone with (food or drink)
help.3: (can/could not help oneself)Cannot or could not avoid.

price.1: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
price.2: An unwelcome experience or action undergone or done as a condition of achieving an objective.

far.1: At, to, or by a great distance (used to indicate the extent to which one thing is distant from another)
far.2: Over a large expanse of space or time.

close.1: Only a short distance away or apart in space or time.
close.2: Denoting a family member who is part of a person's immediate family, typically a parent or sibling.
close.3: (of observation, examination, etc.) done in a careful and thorough way.

store.1: A quantity or supply of something kept for use as needed.
store.2: A shop of any size or kind.
store.3: A sheep, steer, cow, or pig acquired or kept for fattening.

supermarket.1: A large self-service shop selling foods and household goods.
